bibl.title: Despatches from United States Consuls in Gaboon, 1856-1888 T-466

text.body:
Sir,
I have the honor to ackknowledge the receipt of your Despatch Nov. 11th haveing State, October 28,1878, on the 10th of Janurary 1879, about thus month from the have it was written. Our mails during the past year, have been irregular with are essential of siz to eight weeks, between them. The last serviced was just two months, Your Loerpool to Gaboon. The streamers now having ones government subsidy, call at numerous ports on the Coast often are delayed in Freight. There on a merchant steamers which will take these dispatches that make much quickeer passages + deterention of our mails is my apology for asking for been of absence so long in advance. I doubt the leave of absence has granted + is intent for Gaboon. I hope all be *unclear* of next extension from Liverport *unclear* here on to the vesself for offering *unclear row*
